    <title><![CDATA[PM Trudeau's team looking at more staff for Sophie Gregoire Trudeau]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/pm-trudeau-s-team-looking-at-more-staff-for-sophie-gregoire-trudeau-1.2899488</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Prime Minister's Office confirms Sophie Grégoire Trudeau could get additional staff to help her deal with a flood of requests.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Laura Payton]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[Ottawa News Bureau Online Producer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899488</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:18:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:40:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899684.1463080136!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau, wife of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, holds their son Hadrien Grégoire while she greets students from D.C.'s Patterson Elementary School Wednesday, March 9, 2016. (AP / Cliff Owen)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Liberals defend Trudeau's upcoming appearance in federally-funded promotional campaign]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/liberals-defend-trudeau-s-upcoming-appearance-in-federally-funded-promotional-campaign-1.2899782</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Even as it moves to restrict partisan government advertising, the Liberal government is defending Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s upcoming appearance in a promotional campaign funded by a federal tourism agency.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Glen McGregor]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[Senior Political Correspondent]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899782</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:29:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:53:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899800.1463084859!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Prime Minister Justin Trudeau with celebrity chief Kristen Kish, in an Instagram post from three weeks ago  (Source: Instagram / justinpjtrudeau)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Liberals admit decision made on gender equity proposal]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/liberals-admit-decision-made-on-gender-equity-proposal-1.2899776</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Democratic Reform Minister Maryam Monsef now admits she has made up her mind on an NDP proposal to penalize parties that don't run equal numbers of male and female candidates.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Laura Payton]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[Ottawa News Bureau Online Producer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899776</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:15:54 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:15:54 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2897551.1462979455!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Maryam Monsef, Minister of Democratic Institutions, makes an announcement regarding electoral reform during a press conference at the National Press Theatre in Ottawa on Wednesday, May 11, 2016. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Sean Kilpatrick)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Sorry, Trump: Canada isn't committing to double defence spending]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/sorry-trump-canada-isn-t-committing-to-double-defence-spending-1.2899875</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Canada isn't committing to a massive boost in military spending, such as is being demanded of U.S. allies by Donald Trump as part of his presidential election platform.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Alexander Panetta]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899875</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:25:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:32:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899884.1463088238!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump waves as he arrives for a meeting with House Speaker Paul Ryan of Wis., at the Republican National Committee Headquarters on Capitol Hill in Washington, Thursday, May 12, 2016. (AP Photo / Andrew Harnik)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Most government-sponsored Syrian refugees in permanent homes: McCallum]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/most-government-sponsored-syrian-refugees-in-permanent-homes-mccallum-1.2899410</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Immigration Minister John McCallum says 98 per cent of government-sponsored Syrian refugees have now found permanent housing.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899410</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:54:09 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:16:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2791324.1456345779!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Syrian refugees Jamil Haddad, left, and Tony Batekh, 2nd left, George Louka and Edmon Artin, right, have some fun while they attend French classes at a school Wednesday, February 17, 2016 in Montreal. (Ryan Remiorz / THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Federal Liberals make interim move to curb partisan government advertising]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/federal-liberals-make-interim-move-to-curb-partisan-government-advertising-1.2899177</link>
    <description><![CDATA[New measures to scrub self-serving and partisan government communications will take effect immediately, says Treasury Board President Scott Brison -- but that doesn't mean the Liberals will put the brakes on federal ad spending.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Bruce Cheadle]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899177</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:27:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:05:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2772756.1455138952!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[An Economic Action plan sign is pictured in Mississippi Mills, Ont., on August 23, 2010. (Adrian Wyld / The Canadian Press)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Ontario NDP not fully on board with Liberal plan to restrict 3rd-party advertising]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/ontario-ndp-not-fully-on-board-with-liberal-plan-to-restrict-3rd-party-advertising-1.2899688</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Ontario's NDP says fundraising and campaign finance reforms proposed by the Liberals will hamper the ability of interest groups to make their voices heard during elections, while giving the government a free pass on advertising.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Allison Jones]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899688</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:21:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:20:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2899694.1463080644!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Ontario NDP Leader Andrea Horwath speaks in front of supporters while campaigning in Brantford, Ont., on Tuesday, June 10, 2014. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darren Calabrese)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Edmonton, Saskatchewan, B.C. now meet requirements for extra EI, documents show]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/edmonton-saskatchewan-b-c-now-meet-requirements-for-extra-ei-documents-show-1.2899242</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Documents outlining how the federal government chose 12 economic regions for extended EI benefits suggest Edmonton and at least two other areas would now qualify for the same help.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Jordan Press]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2899242</guid>
    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:19:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:29:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2807722.1457404094!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Documents outlining how the federal government chose 12 economic regions for extended EI benefits suggest Edmonton and at least two other areas would now qualify for the same help.]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Senators told they're last hope for suffering Canadians who aren't near death]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/senators-told-they-re-last-hope-for-suffering-canadians-who-aren-t-near-death-1.2898491</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Senators heard an emotional appeal Wednesday to reject the federal government's restrictive approach to medical assistance in dying from the wife of an acclaimed doctor who starved himself to death to end his suffering from brain cancer.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Joan Bryden ]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2898491</guid>
    <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 20:14:38 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 20:14:38 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2582296.1460622971!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Liberal cabinet advised to oppose gender equity bill: document]]></title>
    <link>http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/liberal-cabinet-advised-to-oppose-gender-equity-bill-document-1.2898141</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Liberal government has advised its cabinet to oppose a private member's bill intended to increase the number of women running for Parliament, according to a document obtained by CTV News.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Laura Payton]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[Ottawa News Bureau Online Producer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.2898141</guid>
    <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:11:00 -0400</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:41:00 -0400</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="http://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2740611.1453051231!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Democratic Institutions Minister Maryam Monsef speaks with CTV's Question Period on Jan. 17, 2016.]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
        </channel>
